somebody use gradle in continous integration systems ? I search how to aggregate gradle tasks in one, and run them in certian order ?

for example I have a command

`gradlew clean lintDebug assembleDebug testDebug --stacktrace —info`

I want instead  run for example

`gradlew debug`

or at least

`gradlew debug --stacktrace —info`

CI jenkins

I try to use dependsOn and mustRunAfter

but maybe is better approach

I also think about Jenkinsfile
you can define your own custom gradle task
there is this doLast property of tasks which you can abuse

<https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/build_lifecycle.html>
```
task settings() {
    doFirst{}
    doLast {}
}
```
thanks for sugestions :wink:

<@U2M0WUZ7A> <@U3R7UUSSJ> it works no problem during normal runtime, but `:library` cannot access its resource while `:app` is under *instrumentation*  (`:app` depends on `:library`)
more detail here: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41602042/resourcenotfoundexception-for-resource-in-library-gradle-module-during-instrumen/41602099#41602099>

attachments.title: ResourceNotFoundException for resource in library gradle module during instrumentation test
attachments.text: During an instrumentation test, my app is throwing the following error. This error is not thrown in my non-test builds.android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: String resource ID #0x7f030...
attachments.fallback: ResourceNotFoundException for resource in library gradle module during instrumentation test

text: could it be a proguard issue?
not using proguarx
*proguard
oh wait it's about string.xml
res/values gets merged in modules as far as i know
therefore it can be accessed via app package namespace
but I'm accessing it in `:library` code, which doesn't know about any `:app` code
i see
now i get it
is this a bug? or an intentional limitation of instrumentation testing
does the resource not found error happen during normal app usage as well?
also which gradle build tools / gradle version do you use?
no, it does not happen under normal app usage
`buildTools                   : '25.0.1'
androidGradlePlugin          : '2.2.3',
ok so you're on the latest which is good
point is, i had no such problem on instrumentation so far
so just wondering where it goes wrong
yeah my build is pretty complex because the `:library` module is split into 3 configurations
i assume you have already tried to clean the project?
<@U3PQZMSF6> It looks like the data isn't actually being removed thank you for the help
No problem :)
<@U3R7UUSSJ> yep, tried a clean
can you run the instrumentation test with --stacktrace ond even --info?
it's a little more verbose and might give you some insight on why it has issues with the resource
`android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: String resource ID #0x7f030002` -> you can look what resource `0x7f030002` actually is inside your R class and maybe its just invalid

<@U3R7UUSSJ> what do you mean by invalid? the test apk contains the resources for `app.R.*` , but not the resource for `library.R.*`, which is why the exception is thrown. All `:library` resources ARE merged in the test APK, but as `app.R.*`, not `library.R.*`. (hence the exception)

The `int` values for both are there, though. `app.R.string.pref_key` and `library.R.string.pref_key` have different `int` values, which is why `app.R.string.pref_key` lookup succeeds while `library.R.string.pref_key` fails.

i understand, however that specific exception is known to be thrown if there is anything wrong with resources in general, for instance even if layout/drawable files have bad naming e.g. capital letters somewhere or a drawable with same name but different ending (icon.png, icon.jpg) that's why this exception might be misleading at times, it also gets thrown when there is an error in any layout file, e.g. wrong package name of custom views, etc.

Im trying to set a custom layout as a menu icon, I was able to set it fine but it seems the ripple effect has gone. I sets up an onClickListener on the java side and that is working as well. Just wondering if anyone can help me get the ripple effect back on the menu icon
Here is my XML for the menu:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<menu xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto">
    <item
        android:id="@+id/map_button"
        android:layout_width="35dp"
        android:layout_height="35dp"
        android:icon="@drawable/map_button"
        app:showAsAction="always"
        app:actionLayout="@layout/map_icon_layout"
        android:title="Map View" />
</menu>
```
Here is the XML for the map_icon_layout:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:orientation="vertical" android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:gravity="center"
    android:layout_height="match_parent">

    <ImageView
        android:layout_width="35dp"
        android:layout_height="35dp"
        android:src="@drawable/map_button"
        android:layout_marginBottom="-3dp"
        android:layout_gravity="center"/>

    <TextView
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_gravity="center"
        android:textSize="11sp"
        android:textColor="@color/primaryBlue"
        android:text="MAP"/>

</LinearLayout>
```
